item.title: 前网络安全人员因兼职黑客而认罪
item.description: 周四，两名网络安全公司的前雇员承认犯有联邦罪行，他们发动了自己的勒索软件攻击，阴谋向美国各地的受害者勒索数百万美元。【原文：Two former employees of cybersecurity companies pleaded guilty on Thursday to federal crimes for launching their own ransomware attacks in a plot to extort millions of dollars from victims around the US.】

item.title: 美国消费物价指数提振股市和债券，亚洲股市将上涨：市场综述
item.description: 在降温的通胀数据凸显了美联储减息的理由，以及科技股的平息支撑了美国股市之后，亚洲股市将继续攀升。【原文：Asian equities were set to climb after cooling inflation data underscored the case for Federal Reserve cuts and calming tech jitters supported US stocks.】

item.title: TikTok 表示已就新的美国合资企业签署协议
item.description: TikTok 首席执行官 Shou Chew 告诉员工，该社交媒体公司与其母公司 ByteDance Ltd. 签署了具有约束力的协议，将成立一家由美国投资者控股的美国合资企业。【原文：TikTok Chief Executive Officer Shou Chew told employees that the social media company and its parent, ByteDance Ltd., signed binding agreements to create a US joint venture majority-owned by American investors.】

item.title: 解决法国棘手的债务问题
item.description:
缩减深受人们喜爱的安全网的努力面临立法僵局。Bloomberg Originals探讨了哪些因素可能会迫使改变，哪些因素可能会失去。

Bloomberg Originals探讨了哪些因素可能会迫使改变，哪些因素可能会失去。【原文：

Efforts to shrink its beloved safety net face legislative gridlock. Bloomberg Originals explores what may force change and what could be lost.

】

item.title: 石油充斥全球，价格有望继续下跌
item.description: Almost every day, an oil tanker arrives off the Guyana coast to pick up a cargo that could reach a buyer practically anywhere on the planet. The stream of shipments is all the more remarkable because just a few years ago, the country didn’t pump a single barrel.

item.title: This Year’s Winners and Losers in the Podcast and Music Industries
item.description:
回顾 2025 年的主要商业趋势

。【原文：

A look back at the major business trends of 2025

】

item.title: 麦格理因卖空数据失误支付 2,300 万美元罚款
item.description: Macquarie Group Ltd.’s Australian securities business admitted to misleading conduct in misreporting millions of short sales over several years and agreed to pay a A$35 million ($23 million) fine.

item.title: Netflix 和派拉蒙争夺华纳兄弟，利害关系何在？
item.description: Who ends up with the assets of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., the owner of one of Hollywood’s largest and most venerable film studios, is likely to impact the entertainment industry for decades to come. On Dec. 5, the company announced that Netflix Inc., the world’s dominant streaming platform, had agreed to purchase its streaming and studio assets in a $82.7 billion deal, including debt. Three days later, Paramount Skydance Corp. launched a hostile takeover bid for all of Warner Bros. The offer v

item.title: Francisco Partners 据称酝酿以 10 亿美元出售 MyHeritage
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Francisco Partners 正在考虑出售 DNA 检测服务和家谱平台 MyHeritage，售价可能在 10 亿美元左右。【原文：Francisco Partners is considering a sale of MyHeritage, the DNA testing service and genealogy platform, that could fetch about $1 billion, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 由于中国抛售国债，10 月份外国国债持有量下降
item.description: 由于中国抛售了部分库存，10 月份美国国债的海外持有量有所下降，而日本和英国等国家的持有量则有所增加。【原文：Overseas holdings of US Treasuries dipped in October as China sold down some of its stockpile while countries including Japan and the UK saw increases on the month.】

item.title: 科技界亿万富翁为欧洲核子研究中心的下一次物理突破提供 10 亿美元支持
item.description: 包括埃里克-施密特（Eric Schmidt）和法国泽维尔-尼尔（Xavier Niel）在内的一些科技界富豪已向欧洲核子研究中心（CERN）认捐了多达 8.6 亿欧元（10 亿美元）的资金，用于资助拟议中的大型强子对撞机的后续项目。【原文：Some of the wealthiest individuals in technology including Eric Schmidt and France’s Xavier Niel have pledged as much as €860 million ($1 billion) to CERN to fund a proposed successor to the Large Hadron Collider, as the storied research institute turns to private backers for the first time to back future breakthroughs.】

item.title: 美国农业部官员对第二轮农业援助表示怀疑
item.description: The US Department of Agriculture is unlikely to do a second-round package of aid for struggling farmers struggling in the midst of trade tensions and low crop prices.

item.title: 放宽限制的法案未获通过，Airbnb 在纽约卷土重来泡汤
item.description: 由 Airbnb 公司支持的一项本可放宽纽约市一些短租限制的法案未能进入当地立法者今年的最后投票议程，这使该公司在美国最繁忙的旅游市场之一重新获得吸引力的努力再次受挫。【原文：An Airbnb Inc.-backed bill that would have eased some short-term rental restrictions in New York City failed to make local legislators’ final voting agenda of the year, dealing another setback to the company’s efforts to regain traction in one of the busiest tourism markets in the US.】

item.title: 美联储主席古尔斯比称赞通胀报告 "良好"，希望获得更多数据
item.description: Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Austan Goolsbee lauded the November inflation report, which showed a cooling in price pressures, saying it contained a “lot to like.”

item.title: 摩根大通夺回 2025 年美国投资级信贷销售冠军宝座
item.description: 摩根大通在 2024 年被美国银行淘汰后，今年重新夺回了美国投资级公司债券排行榜的榜首位置。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. reclaimed the top spot on the US investment-grade corporate bond league table this year, after being edged out by Bank of America in 2024.】

item.title: 经济学家称，OpenAI "绝对不会 "太大而倒闭
item.description: 如果人工智能泡沫破灭，一位著名经济学家并不过分担心其后果。但首先...【原文：A leading economist isn’t overly concerned about the fallout from the AI bubble bursting, if it happens. But first…】

item.title: 丰田汽车公司的收购出价比其所持股票低 16
item.description: 丰田集团拟以 4.7 万亿日元（约合 300 亿美元）的价格对一家叉车制造商进行私有化，这促使世界上最顽强的激进基金之一称其报价过低。仔细研究一下目标公司的持股情况，就能解释其中的原因。【原文：Toyota group’s proposed ¥4.7 trillion ($30 billion) offer to privatize a forklift maker has prompted one of the world’s most tenacious activist funds to call it a lowball offer. A closer look at the target’s shareholdings helps explain why.】

item.title: AI Demand Strains Japan Cable Firm Fujikura After Stock Surge
item.description: 由于全球新建的数据中心对藤仓有限公司的电缆需求旺盛，该公司的股价在过去两年中飙升了约 1400%。问题只有一个：公司无法满足需求。【原文：Fujikura Ltd.’s stock has surged about 1,400% over the last two years as new data centers globally have created an insatiable appetite for its cables. There’s only one problem — the company can’t keep up with demand.】

item.title: Liberia Backs Ivanhoe Atlantic Rail Deal to Unlock Iron Ore Mine
item.description: 一家由亿万富翁罗伯特-弗里德兰（Robert Friedland）支持的美国公司在邻国利比里亚的立法者批准了一项允许该公司使用出口铁路的协议后，向在几内亚建设铁矿迈出了关键的一步。【原文：A US company backed by billionaire Robert Friedland took a key step toward building an iron ore mine in Guinea after lawmakers in neighboring Liberia greenlit an agreement allowing the firm to access an export railway.】

item.title: 高管表示，OpenAI 已多次宣布 "红色条规
item.description: Sam Altman’s decision to declare a “code red” at OpenAI earlier this month may have caught the industry’s attention, but it wasn’t a first for the artificial intelligence company.

item.title: 客户强烈抗议后，LG 将允许电视机用户删除微软 Copilot 系统
item.description: 在消费者的强烈反对下，LG 电子公司将允许其电视机用户删除微软公司的人工智能软件。【原文：LG Electronics Inc. will let owners of its televisions delete Microsoft Corp.’s artificial intelligence software amid a consumer backlash.】

item.title: 摩根大通和 GoldenTree 为布鲁克林开发项目贷款 5.25 亿美元
item.description: JPMorgan Chase & Co. and GoldenTree Asset Management financed a $525 million construction loan for a development along the Williamsburg waterfront in Brooklyn.

item.title: 美国开发金融机构在扩张中瞄准人工智能和矿产
item.description: A US development-finance agency that’s on track for a tripling in funding aims to invest in data centers for artificial intelligence, as well as critical minerals and energy, according to a top official.

item.title: Trump Praises Waller and Bowman, Says Fed Pick Coming in Weeks
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，他正在面试 "三到四位 "美联储主席候选人，并预计将很快决定提名谁来接替杰罗姆-鲍威尔。【原文：President Donald Trump said he was interviewing “three or four” candidates for Federal Reserve chair and expected to have a decision pretty quickly on who he would nominate to replace Jerome Powell.】

item.title: 顽皮狗工作室为《星际迷航》勒令员工加班
item.description:
索尼旗下的游戏开发商一直在争分夺秒地赶在 12 月的最后期限之前完成任务 

。【原文：

The Sony-owned gamemakers have been racing to hit a December deadline 

】

item.title: Nexi 拒绝 TPG 对数字银行部门的 10 亿欧元收购要约
item.description: 意大利数字支付公司 Nexi SpA 拒绝了 TPG 对其数字银行解决方案部门的收购要约，这标志着该公司又一次失败的出售尝试。【原文：Italy’s digital payment company Nexi SpA rejected an offer by TPG for its digital banking solutions unit, marking a new failed attempt to sell it.】

item.title: 甲骨文和 OpenAI 获密歇根州批准为新数据中心供电
item.description: Michigan regulators unanimously approved a request from utility DTE Energy Co. to power a massive data center development planned by Oracle and OpenAI following a contentious hearing.

item.title: Instacart 在联邦贸易委员会消费者保护案中支付 6000 万美元
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会表示，食品杂货配送公司Instacart将支付6000万美元，以退还那些受骗注册该公司订阅服务Instacart+的消费者。【原文：Grocery delivery firm Instacart will pay $60 million to refund consumers who were deceived into enrolling in the company’s subscription service, Instacart+, the US Federal Trade Commission said.】

item.title: 即使通胀加速，墨西哥仍削减四分之一个百分点
item.description: 墨西哥中央银行将基准利率下调了四分之一个百分点，这是一系列降息措施中的最新一次，旨在刺激经济增长，尽管人们对顽固的通货膨胀忧心忡忡。【原文：Mexico’s central bank lowered its benchmark interest rate by a quarter point, the latest in a series of cuts aimed at sparking economic growth despite worries over stubborn inflation.】

item.title: 针对野火的巨灾债券失去 "不可触碰 "的地位
item.description: 另类投资经理们开始对与野火相关的巨灾债券产生浓厚兴趣，开始涉足这个几年前还被认为难以建模的风险类别。【原文：Alternative investment managers are starting to take a serious interest in catastrophe bonds tied to wildfires, moving into a risk category that just a few years ago was seen as too difficult to model.】
